<div class="tourbrd">
<h1>Colorful Rajasthan Tour Package</h1>
<p><span><a href="/" title="Home">Home</a> » <a href="/india-tour-packages" title="India Tour Packages">India</a> » <a href="/rajasthan-tour-packages" title="Rajasthan Tour Packages">Rajasthan</a> » <span class="breadcrumb_last" aria-current="page">Colorful Rajasthan Tour Package</span></span></p>
</div>

<div id="cmsmasters_row_673c32eaa01779_76256623" class="cmsmasters_row cmsmasters_color_scheme_default tourflexBox cmsmasters_row_top_default cmsmasters_row_bot_default cmsmasters_row_boxed">
<div id="tourflexBox2" class="cmsmasters_row_outer_parent">
<div class="cmsmasters_row_outer">
<div class="cmsmasters_row_inner">
<div class="cmsmasters_row_margin">
<div class="cmsmasters_column two_third">
<div class="custom_html tourIB1">
<div class="proGall"><img decoding="async" src="/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/rajasthan-group.jpg" alt="Rajasthan Group Tour Package" title="Rajasthan Group Tour Package" width="750" height="450" loading="lazy"></div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB2">
<div class="tour-overview">
<div class="toBt"><i class="fa fa-file"></i> Tour Overview</div>
<p>The 12 Nights / 13 Days Colorful Rajasthan Tour package offers a captivating exploration of Rajasthan’s enchanting destinations. In addition to this, you will have the opportunity to embark on a city tour in Delhi and Agra. Immerse yourself in the vibrant culture and delectable cuisine of Rajasthan during this remarkable tour. One of the highlights of this trip is witnessing the architectural brilliance and the harmonious blend of Hindu, Mughal, and Rajput influences. Nowhere else in the world will you find streets, markets, and bazaars as vibrant and lively as those in Rajasthan. For a more comprehensive understanding of this extraordinary journey, please refer to the detailed itinerary provided below.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB4">
<div class="tour-collection">
<h2 class="tourDBox"><i class="fa fa-bus" aria-hidden="true"></i> Colorful Rajasthan Tour Itinerary Package</h2>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details" id="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 1 :</span>Delhi – Sariska (271 Kms / 4 Hrs)</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="">
<p>On arrival at Delhi Airport/ Railway station, our Namaste India Representative will greet you and later drive to Sariska- A National Park. Upon arrival check in at hotel. We take Jungle Safari to Sariska Tiger Reserve which has characteristics Fauna of dry zone and antelopes, deer, caracal, jungle cat, hyena, jackal with plenty of birds in the natural valley. Overnight at the hotel.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 2 :</span>Sariska – Ranthambore</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>The morning after breakfast transfer to Ranthambore, check into a hotel, after lunch visit to Ranthambhore National Park. (Entrance fee to National Park are extra).</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 3 :</span>Ranthambore – Sawai Madhopur – Jaipur</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>The morning after breakfast, transfer to Jaipur. Enroute Visit Sawai Madhopur and check into the hotel on arrival at Jaipur. Evening free for shopping and for the scroll on the city. Overnight stay at Jaipur.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 4 :</span>Jaipur Sightseeing</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>This morning, after breakfast, visits the ancient capital of the Kachwaha Rajputs, Amer. One can take an elephant ride or the jeep ride up to the fort. Thereafter, enjoy a photo-stop at Hawa Mahal – the Palace of Winds. Later, visit the City Palace and the apartment housing museums with an array of textiles, costumes, arms, weapons and paintings and finally visit Jantar Mantar, the observatory built by Maharaja Jai Singh-II. The founder of Jantar Mantar is Maharaja Jai Singh II, he had built Jantar Mantar in five different locations of India, out of which Jantar Mantar at Jaipur is the largest. The observatories, or ‘Jantar Mantar’ as they are commonly known, incorporate multiple buildings of unique form, each with a specialized function for astronomical measurement.</p>
<p>Later you are free to enjoy shopping in the local market. The market of Jaipur will delight you with the exotic blue pottery, the batik painting, block printed textiles of Sanganer and Bagru, tie and dye fabrics, Mojari – (the local shoe), sandalwood carving items, beautiful stone carvings etc.</p>
</p></div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 5 :</span>Jaipur – Bikaner (335 Kms / 6 Hrs)</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Today After breakfast drive to Bikaner, Enroute visit Deshnok Temple and Camel-breeding Farm just before Bikaner. Overnight stay at Bikaner.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 6 :</span>Bikaner – Jaisalmer (329 Kms / 5.5 Hrs)</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Morning half Day visits fabulous Junagarh Fort & Lalgarh Palace and proceeds for Jaisalmer. Visit Kheechan on the way, and reach Jaisalmer Check-in at hotel in Jaisalmer. Overnight stay at Jaisalmer.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 7 :</span>Jaisalmer Sightseeing</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Visit Jaisalmer Fort & Museum after breakfast. Also, see the Jain Temple. Take a walk through the back streets to the Patwon Ki Haveli & Kothari Haveli. After lunch proceeds to Kuldhera – An abandoned habitation, and then to Sam Sand Dunes. Here camp stay will be provided with folk dance and songs with Rajasthani Dinner.</p>
<p>Sam Sand Dunes: Sam sand dunes are becoming the major attraction in Jaisalmer. This is the closest place from where you can lose yourself in ‘The Great Thar Desert’. Sam has a truly magnificent stretch of sweeping dunes, with sparse or no vegetation.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 8 :</span>Jaisalmer – Pokhran – Jodhpur (307 Kms / 6 Hrs)</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>The morning after breakfast transfer to Jodhpur, The Sun City. On the way to Jodhpur, you can have your lunch at Fort Pokaran which literally means the palace of five mirages. Enroute you can also visit Bishnoi Villages where people believe in conserving the natural environment and animal hunting is banned there. You can spot numerous deer in Bishnoi Village. Arrive Jodhpur and get assisted check into the hotel. After taking some rest in the hotel we begin the city tour of Jodhpur which comprises of visit to the impressive Mehrangarh Fort – This magnificent fort was built in the 15th century and has seven gates which still witness marks of the battle fought by armies of Jodhpur to protect their people, Jaswant Thada – Looks like a temple, this white marble was constructed in the memory of Maharaja Jaswant Singh II, last but not to miss is Umaid Bhawan Palace – This stunning palace which today also serves as the residence to the royal family and a part of it is transformed into a luxurious hotel. The evening is free to relax and overnight stay is in Jodhpur.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 9 :</span>Jodhpur – Udaipur (270 Kms / 05 Hrs)</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>The morning after breakfast transfer to Udaipur, A beautiful romantic city also known as the City of Lakes”. Enroute visit Ranakpur Jain Temple – These temples were built in the 15 century during the rule of Rana Kumbha and today the temples are one of the most sacred places for Jainism. The main temple to visit is the Chaumukha Temple or four-faced temple. Upon arrival, a warm greeting awaits you at the hotel check into the hotel. Evening you can enjoy boat ride on the beautiful Lake Pichola. Overnight stay is at hotel in Udaipur.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 10 :</span>Udaipur Sightseeing</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Today we are fully packed with Udaipur Sightseeing. After breakfast proceeds to explore the attractions of the city including City Palace, Saheliyon Ki Bari, Lake Pichola, Jagdish Temple, Kumbhalgarh Fort, Dolls Museum and Fateh Sagar Lake. Overnight stay at Udaipur.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 11 :</span>Udaipur – Pushkar (283 Kms / 5:30 Hrs)</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>The morning after breakfast drive by surface to Pushkar. On arrival check into the hotel. Afternoon proceeds for sightseeing tour of Dargah (Indian’s Macca) in Ajmer and Lord Brahma Temple at Pushkar. This little town is hugely known for the “Pushkar Fair” (where the mass trading of camels takes place), “the Lord Brahma Temple”, a “picturesque lake’ and “camel fair”. Rest of the day free for leisure activities. Overnight at the hotel.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 12 :</span>Pushkar – Ajmer – Jaipur (132 Kms / 3 Hrs)</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>The morning after breakfast transfer to Jaipur. Enroute stop for the worship of saint Khwaja Moinuddin Chishti who came with Muhammad Ghori from Persia in 1192 settled here. Thus the place where he was buried is today known as the Dargah Sharif. Later drive to Jaipur. Evening free for shopping. At night we are set for local cousins, music, and dance at Chokhi Dhani. Overnight stay at Jaipur.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 13 :</span>Jaipur – Delhi Departure (132 Kms / 3 Hrs)</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>The morning after breakfast, drive to Delhi for your onward journey. Tour ends here.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="custom_html tourIB8">
<div id="popularBox8" class="tour-collection">
<h3><i class="fa fa-question-circle" aria-hidden="true"></i> FAQs for Colorful Rajasthan Tour</h3>
<div class="panel-body">
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> Which Months Are Ideal For A Rajasthan Tour?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Tourists visit Rajasthan all year, but the best time to visit is during the winter months of November to February, when the temperatures are not too hot. Temperatures can vary dramatically between day and night during December and January.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Is Most Common In Rajasthan?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Rajasthan produces nearly all of the country's calcite and natural gypsum. Asbestos, copper concentrate, ochre, Phosphorite/rock phosphate, silver, steatite, ball clay, fluorite, and feldspar are all major products of the state. The state is also a major producer of marble in a variety of colours.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> Which Month Has The Most Rain In Rajasthan?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> The majority of the southwest monsoon rains in Rajasthan fall between July and August.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> Rajasthan Has Three Types Of Forests?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Tropical dry and deciduous forest covers a large area of the state from east to south-east and includes many forests such as Dry teak, Salar, Bamboo, Dhokra, Palash, Khair, Babul, and Mixed deciduous forest.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> Why Is Rajasthan Famous For Its Cuisine?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Rajasthani cuisine is influenced by the state's rich heritage and arid climate. Their cuisine is distinguished by the scarcity of fresh fruits and vegetables. Beans, lentils, gramme flour, corn, barley, millet, Bajra, bread, and dairy products are all common ingredients especially Ghee.</p>
</p></div></div></div></div></div>
